awd_titl_txt: REU Site: CNS: Sensing and Smart Systems
awd_abstract_narration:
This award renews a Research Experiences for Undergraduates (REU) Site at Florida Atlantic University. Faculty in the Institute for Sensing and Embedded Network Systems Engineering will host cohorts of undergraduate students for summer research in the area of sensing and smart systems. Smart systems represent an emerging class of computing systems that provide real-time awareness of conditions, trends, and patterns to support improved decision-making and automated control. Smart systems offer a significant application potential that makes their design and application appealing to undergraduate researchers.  The recruitment and selection procedures will ensure that the program engages a diverse demographic, including a significant number of women and members of underrepresented minorities. Many of the participants will be recruited from institutions where there are limited research opportunities for undergraduates. In addition to conducting research the students will participate in other professional development activities such as industry field trips, professional seminars, speakers and career guidance, and graduate school preparation.  An external evaluator will measure the success of the site and the impact on the students.  

The REU site is led by faculty mentors from the Institute for Sensing and Embedded Network Systems Engineering (I-Sense). The faculty of the I-Sense Institute have significant research expertise and offer state-of-the-art facilities that should provide a compelling research experience to undergraduates. The undergraduates will be woven into existing research groups and projects that are working on current and emerging applications that have real-world connections.  The research will focus on three main areas of application expertise including infrastructure systems, marine and environment, and health and behavior. The projects span diverse contexts of exploration and application, unified in their focus on sensing and smart systems. The exploration space presents myriad challenges at the confluence of sensing, computing, signal processing, artificial intelligence, and cyber-physical control.  The site focus and associated research projects present an outstanding opportunity for catalyzing interdisciplinary exploration and discovery that will excite students and demonstrate scientific discovery and exploration at a high level.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
Advancements in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) are key drivers of economic growth and innovation in the United States. Maintaining this trajectory requires a skilled and diverse workforce, making it critical to strengthen STEM pipeline programs that cultivate the next generation of researchers, engineers, and industry leaders. By expanding access to hands-on research experiences, such programs can inspire students to pursue advanced degrees and careers in STEM fields, ensuring the nation remains globally competitive.

To address this need, Florida Atlantic University's Institute for Sensing and Embedded Network Systems Engineering (I-SENSE) hosted an interdisciplinary Research Experiences for Undergraduates (REU) site from 2021 to 2024, focusing on sensing and smart systems. Closely linked to the Internet of Things (IoT), smart systems integrate advanced sensing, data analytics, and automation to enable real-time awareness of conditions, trends, and patterns. These technologies are transforming fields such as healthcare, urban planning, smart grids, smart cities, oceanography, and environmental monitoring. Given their broad applications, smart systems provide an ideal foundation for an REU program, attracting students from diverse STEM disciplines and fostering interdisciplinary research collaboration.

The REU site engaged over 30 high-potential undergraduates from across the country, offering immersive research experience designed to encourage graduate study and career development in STEM. The program focused on cultivating technical, interpersonal, and communication skills through structured training seminars, hands-on research, and professional development workshops. It also aimed to enhance participants' confidence in their research abilities and career potential through personalized mentorship and networking opportunities, with many students maintaining long-term connections with their mentors. The program ignited interest in interdisciplinary research by providing students with opportunities to tackle complex, real-world challenges that required collaborative problem-solving and cross-disciplinary expertise. Additionally, it fostered a supportive and engaged research community by encouraging teamwork, peer interaction, and shared laboratory experiences.

Program evaluation results highlight the REU site's success in achieving these objectives. Participants consistently reported significant learning gains, both in technical expertise and transferable skills. Many acquired proficiency in new programming languages (e.g., Python, C, and Matlab), developed innovative data collection and analysis techniques, and learned novel approaches to problem-solving within their research domains. Beyond technical skills, students gained valuable experience in teamwork, time management, and self-advocacy, critical competencies for success in academia and the workforce. Faculty mentors also benefited from REU participation, noting increased research productivity and a strengthened sense of academic community. Several mentors reflected on how working with students allowed them to revisit the foundational principles of their research, fostering deeper engagement with their own work. The most exciting outcome, however, was the lasting impact on participants. Many students expressed a newfound understanding of research and graduate education, with program activities and workshops providing essential guidance on navigating the graduate school application process.

Through its emphasis on interdisciplinary research, mentorship, and skill development, the I-SENSE REU site successfully prepared students for the next stages of their academic and professional journeys. By equipping participants with the tools to thrive in STEM, the program contributed to strengthening the nation's STEM workforce and fostering future innovations in smart systems and beyond.
